result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: TRIAL SCHEDULING ORDER
Jury trial on March 13, 2023 at 08:00 am.
Jury selection on March 13, 2023 at 08:00 am.
Final pre-trial on February 16, 2023 at 02:00 pm.
Request for trial dates

11:02 AM Defendant Allen R. Golden in court.  Attorney Melissa Anne Frost in court for Allen R. Golden.  Prosecuting attorney Gerald Anthony Urbik in court for the State of Wisconsin. Amended  Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived. Defendant pleads not guilty on Count two. Parties address court regarding bond. Court modifies bond conditions, Maintain absolute sobriety, Curfew 8PM-6AM, allowed to drive as long as cleared by State of Wisconsin and medical provider.
Prev. Posted. Maintain absolute sobriety. Curfew 8PM-6AM unless traveling to and from work. May drive as long as cleared by State of Wisconsin and Medical provider.
Bail/bond hearing on August 23, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Bond amount was not on bond.  Left message with defendant and emailed Attorney Frost for Mr Golden to come in and sign a corrected bond.
INITIAL SCHEDULING ORDER

Activity:  Arraingment

02:25 PM Defendant Allen R. Golden in court by phone with attorney Melissa Anne Frost by video.  Margaret Nan Ginocchio appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.    Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived.  Defendant pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set.  Bond continued.

Absolute sobriety.   No driving at all. Curfew from 8pm to 6am unless traveling to and from work.

Testimony taken; Court finds probable cause and binds Defendant over for filing of an Information.  Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived.  Court amends cash bond condition.  Curfew 8pm until 6am.  Araignment on June 22,  2022 at 1:00 pm.

David S Olson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Address and date of birth verified.
